result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay T. White Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Must undergo Anger Management Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any bar or tavern.

Take all medications as prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations and/or continue with treatment plan currently in place.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within first year of probation

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF109, but consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

Same conditions as Count 1, with no additional community service hours.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Defendant Jay T. White in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:35 AM. Called 15CF41 and 15CF109. Verhove has revocation summary, no inaccuracies or inconsistencies. Court reviews ROAW. Court and counsel go thru credit, 2 days on 15CF109 and 51 days on 15CF41. State makes final argument prior to his recommendation - recommends on both counts of 15CF109 - 6 years in WI State Prison System concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving, consisting of 3 years of intial confinement followed by 3 years of ES; on 15CF41 - count #1 - 9 months in FC jail, count #3 - 3.5 years in WI State Prison System, concurrent to count #1 and to 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving. VerHoeve makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1 year in FC jail and be allowed to serve some of that time in inpatient treatment program. White makes statement. Court has questions in regards to the credit that has been calculated. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF109 - #1 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES -  consecutive to any other sentence (13CF141), #3 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to any other sentence (13CF141); on 15CF41 - count #1 - 9 months in FC jail - concurrent with 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence(13CF141); #3 - 3 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to count #1 and to 15CF109 but consecutive to any other sentence(13CF141), submit DNA sample, not sure if he is eligible for programs but will make him eligible for programs, credit on 15CF109 of 324 days, credit for 103 days on 15CF41, turn unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 30, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
for Furlough

Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:57 pm. State has complied with victim notification. Victim in courtroom. Penn makes statement recites joint recommendation. Count 1 - plead as alleged - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years. Count 2 - DRI. Count 3 w/hold sentence, 2 years probation, fine of $500 plus costs & surcharges. Count 4 -DRI. Count 5 - DRI. Conditions of probation - AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, restitution to be determined, no possess/consume/entry, emp/school (w/verbage 36 hrs per week) 100 hrs community service, take all meds as prescribed. Defendant pleads G to counts 1 & 3. Court DIR counts 2, 4 & 5. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds defendant entering plea freely, voluntarily and intellgently, by entering plea and waiving right to JT factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guility of counts 1 & 3. State/Penn make statement. White makes statement, remorseful. Penn 51 days credit if revoked. Victim makes statement. Court sentences to following:

Count 1 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of AODA and follow thru and continue with treatment plan in place, anger management and follow thru, no possess/consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT emp/school with verbage, 100 hrs co service to be completed within 1st year of probation, take all medication as prescribed, 1 AA/NA meeting per week, costs/surcharges, must submit DNA sample. 51 days credit if revoked (stipulated)

Count 3 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years concurrent to count 1 same conditions with no additional community service hours and fine of $500 plus costs/surcharge. 

Appeal - voting - firearms rights given.
Final pre-trial at 07-22-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant Jay T. White in court with attorney David V. Penn.  Defendant Jay T. White in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:49 PM. Penn and White have complaint, waives further reading, has talked to the defendant and parties have decided to waive the PH, has completed the form and provides that to the Court - will also proceed to ARGN today as long as the Information mirrors the complaint, also will be arguing for a bond reduction or amend bond to allow the defendant to enter into treatment at Koinonia. Court has waiver of PH, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Penn will proceed to ARGN based upon criminal complaint. Court will allow that, State to file Information within 10 days that mirrors complaint. Penn enters NG to all counts. Court sets for FPT. Court modifies bond to $5000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with R.R.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Jay T. White not in court, defendant in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calleed at 9:38 AM. State has a letter from Attorney David Penn stating that he does not represent the defendant. White clarifies the situation with hiring David Penn - needs time to retain the attorney. State - no objections to AIA 4-6 weeks out but not reducing bond. Court will allow an adjournment, continues bond, set for another AIA. Court does advise of right to attorney and court appointed attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Jay T. White appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:16 p.m. Defendant not sure if received a criminal complaint. Court reads penalties, charges and right to attorney. Defendant understands charges and penalties. Defendant would like attorney, states he has retained David Penn. Court instructs to contact to attorney and inform him of AIA.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
